text: "Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo" (also called "The Magic Song") is a novelty song. It was written in 1948 by Al Hoffman, Mack David, and Jerry Livingston. It was first used in the 1950 movie Cinderella. In this movie, it was sung by the actress Verna Felton. The song is about the Fairy Godmother turning a pumpkin into a carriage, which is something that happens in the story of Cinderella. ==References== Category:1948 songs Category:The Walt Disney Company Category:Perry Como songs Category:Jo Stafford songs Category:The Fontane Sisters songs
title: Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo
